Detailed Description

Offers a wxProcess with default output to a wxExSTCShell on a wxExSTCEntryDialog.

You can change that by inheriting this class and provide your own report generators.

Member Function Documentation

static int wxExProcess::ConfigDialog ( wxWindow *  parent,
const wxString &  title = _("Select Process") 
) [static]

Shows a config dialog, sets the command and returns dialog return code.

long wxExProcess::Execute ( const wxString &  command = wxEmptyString,
int  flags = wxEXEC_ASYNC,
const wxString &  wd = wxEmptyString 
)

Executes the process asynchronously (this call immediately returns).

For each output line ReportAdd is invoked. The return value is the process id and zero value indicates that the command could not be executed. The return value can also be -1, if config dialog was invoked and cancelled. When the process is finished, a ID_TERMINATED_PROCESS command event is sent to the application top window.

Parameters:
commandcommand to be executed, if empty last given command is used
flagsflags for wxExecute
wdworking dir, if empty last working dir is used
bool wxExProcess::GetError ( ) const [inline]

Returns true if the output contains error info instead of normal info.

virtual void wxExProcess::ReportAdd ( const wxString &  line,
const wxString &  path,
const wxString &  lineno 
) [protected, virtual]

Override to add a process output line to report.

Default puts the message on the STC shell.

Parameters:
linecomplete line (not empty)
pathpath from line (if available)
linenolineno from line (if available)

Reimplemented in wxExProcessListView.

virtual void wxExProcess::ReportCreate ( ) [protected, virtual]

Override to create a report.

Called for each invocation of Execute. Default report creator uses a wxExSTShell.

Reimplemented in wxExProcessListView.
